column2: by buying some of her shoestrings
column3: of course."Ellen had some money of her own put away in a box. She ran and got it

column8: she asked the poor woman to come in and get some luncheon.The poor woman gladly accepted the invitation; and Ellen soon had her seated by a nice fire in the kitchen
column9: chatting and laughing with the maids as merrily as if she had no care in the world."Have I made you happy?" asked Ellen. "That you have
column11: said the poor woman, with a tear in her eye. And so you have made me happy
column12: replied Ellen. Yes, she had found that Aunt Alice was in the right. The best way to cheer yourself is to cheer another."
